title: Best Black Friday VPN deals 2025: Early sales and perks for Surfshark, NordVPN, and more

Best early Black Friday VPN deals 2025: I'm tracking 10 of my favorite discounts live now
Black Friday is a month away, but many virtual private network (VPN) providers have already launched early holiday sales.
VPNs are becoming increasingly important in protecting your online security and privacy. They can change your IP address location, layer encryption to disguise your online activities, and often come with additional security features, such as password managers and data breach alert systems.
Also: The best VPN services we've tested
If you're interested in trying out a VPN, now is the perfect time, as many subscriptions hit their lowest price of the year. I've reviewed and tested VPNs for years, and kept a close watch on prices and subscription changes, and so the deals I've listed below are worth your time.
I will be updating my Black Friday VPN deal recommendations as more VPN providers launch their own sales. To find the best deals so far, check out my favorites below.

FAQs
When is Black Friday?
Black Friday used to just be on the last Friday of November each year. However, many retailers now offer their own sales over the course of a full week, and so you can expect sales to appear from around Monday, Nov. 24. Black Friday itself lands on Friday, Nov. 28, and leads up to Cyber Monday on Dec. 1.
Are VPNs really cheaper during Black Friday?
Yes, they can be. Or, at least, you will find upgraded services available for the same price that are only around during promotional events. The closer we get to Black Friday, the more likely VPN deals are to appear -- especially as rival companies compete for your attention. You'll be able to pick up a solid, secure VPN for as little as a few dollars per month.
How did we choose these early Black Friday deals?
ZDNET only writes about deals that capture our own interest -- devices and products we want, need, or would recommend not only to our readers, but to friends and family. Our experts look for deals at least 20% off (or hardly ever on sale), using established price-comparison tools and trackers to determine whether the deal is actually worth your time.
We also examine customer reviews and rely on our own hands-on experience with new tech to find out what matters to real people who already own and use the products we're recommending. The goal is to deliver the most accurate advice and to make you aware of price drops so you can shop smarter.
